article_title: GOP Optimism on Smoother Spending-Bill Process Faces Reality
article_text:
WASHINGTON—House Speaker Paul Ryan and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell share a top priority for next year: pass all 12 government spending bills on time and without drama.

But avoiding a giant, year-end spending fight is an often-promised, rarely delivered goal because of sharp disagreements between the two parties—and sometimes within them—over both spending levels and policy.

As they wrapped up a long and painful...
